trans-unit.source: Planning for business continuity in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Planning for business continuity in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Overview of business continuity in SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Overview of business continuity in SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: This article walks through the basics of planning business continuity and disaster recovery with the SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: This article walks through the basics of planning business continuity and disaster recovery with the SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: Data warehouses are the central repository of information for businesses and they play a critical role in the day-to-day operations for analytics and business intelligence at all levels of the organization.
trans-unit.target: Data warehouses are the central repository of information for businesses and they play a critical role in the day-to-day operations for analytics and business intelligence at all levels of the organization.

trans-unit.source: It is therefore essential that your data warehouse is reliable and allows for recoverability and continuous operation.
trans-unit.target: It is therefore essential that your data warehouse is reliable and allows for recoverability and continuous operation.

trans-unit.source: In particular, this article will show you how SQL Data Warehouse allows you to recover from user errors and disasters using Point-in-Time Restore and Geo-Restore.
trans-unit.target: In particular, this article will show you how SQL Data Warehouse allows you to recover from user errors and disasters using Point-in-Time Restore and Geo-Restore.

trans-unit.source: Business continuity and disaster recovery plans need to optimize for the following:
trans-unit.target: Business continuity and disaster recovery plans need to optimize for the following:

trans-unit.source: Recovery Time Objective (RTO): The maximum acceptable time before the database fully recovers after a disruptive event i.e. maximum loss of availability during failures.
trans-unit.target: Recovery Time Objective (RTO): The maximum acceptable time before the database fully recovers after a disruptive event i.e. maximum loss of availability during failures.

trans-unit.source: Recovery Point Objective (RPO): The maximum acceptable time window of lost updates when the database recovers from a disruptive event i.e. maximum loss of data during failures.
trans-unit.target: Recovery Point Objective (RPO): The maximum acceptable time window of lost updates when the database recovers from a disruptive event i.e. maximum loss of data during failures.

trans-unit.source: Estimated Recovery Time (ERT): The estimated duration for the database to be fully functional after a restore request.
trans-unit.target: Estimated Recovery Time (ERT): The estimated duration for the database to be fully functional after a restore request.

trans-unit.source: Recovering from infrastructure failures: This scenario refers to recovering from infrastructure issues such as disk failures etc. A customer would like to ensure business continuity with a fault tolerant and highly available infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Recovering from infrastructure failures: This scenario refers to recovering from infrastructure issues such as disk failures etc. A customer would like to ensure business continuity with a fault tolerant and highly available infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Recovering from user errors: This scenario refers to recovering from unintentional or incidental Data Corruption or Deletion.
trans-unit.target: Recovering from user errors: This scenario refers to recovering from unintentional or incidental Data Corruption or Deletion.

trans-unit.source: In the event that a user unintentionally or incidentally modifies or deletes data, a customer would like to ensure business continuity by restoring the database to an earlier point in time.
trans-unit.target: In the event that a user unintentionally or incidentally modifies or deletes data, a customer would like to ensure business continuity by restoring the database to an earlier point in time.

trans-unit.source: Recovering from disasters (DR): This scenario refers to recovering from a major catastrophe.
trans-unit.target: Recovering from disasters (DR): This scenario refers to recovering from a major catastrophe.

trans-unit.source: In the scenario where a disruptive event like a natural disaster or a regional outage causes the database to become unavailable, a customer would like to recover the database in a different region to continue business operations.
trans-unit.target: In the scenario where a disruptive event like a natural disaster or a regional outage causes the database to become unavailable, a customer would like to recover the database in a different region to continue business operations.

trans-unit.source: Let us take a look at how SQL Data Warehouse enhances the reliability of your database and allows for recoverability and continuous operation in the aforementioned scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Let us take a look at how SQL Data Warehouse enhances the reliability of your database and allows for recoverability and continuous operation in the aforementioned scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Since SQL Data Warehouse separates compute and storage, all your data is directly written to geo-redundant Azure Storage (RA-GRS).
trans-unit.target: Since SQL Data Warehouse separates compute and storage, all your data is directly written to geo-redundant Azure Storage (RA-GRS).

trans-unit.source: Geo-redundant storage replicates your data to a secondary region that is hundreds of miles away from the primary region.
trans-unit.target: Geo-redundant storage replicates your data to a secondary region that is hundreds of miles away from the primary region.

trans-unit.source: In both primary and secondary regions, your data is replicated three times each, across separate fault domains and upgrade domains.
trans-unit.target: In both primary and secondary regions, your data is replicated three times each, across separate fault domains and upgrade domains.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that your data is durable even in the case of a complete regional outage or disaster that renders one of the regions unavailable.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that your data is durable even in the case of a complete regional outage or disaster that renders one of the regions unavailable.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Read-Access Geo-Redundant Storage, read <linkText>Azure storage redundancy options</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Read-Access Geo-Redundant Storage, read <linkText>Azure storage redundancy options</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Database restore is designed to restore your database to an earlier point in time.
trans-unit.target: Database restore is designed to restore your database to an earlier point in time.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Data Warehouse service protects all databases with automatic storage snapshots every 8 hours and retains them for 7 days to provide you with a discrete set of restore points.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Data Warehouse service protects all databases with automatic storage snapshots every 8 hours and retains them for 7 days to provide you with a discrete set of restore points.

trans-unit.source: These backups are stored on RA-GRS Azure Storage and are therefore geo-redundant by default.
trans-unit.target: These backups are stored on RA-GRS Azure Storage and are therefore geo-redundant by default.

trans-unit.source: The automatic backup and restore features come with no additional charges and provide a zero-cost and zero-admin way to protect databases from accidental corruption or deletion.
trans-unit.target: The automatic backup and restore features come with no additional charges and provide a zero-cost and zero-admin way to protect databases from accidental corruption or deletion.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about database restore, refer to <linkText>Recover from user error</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about database restore, refer to <linkText>Recover from user error</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore is designed to recover your database in case it becomes unavailable due to a disruptive event.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore is designed to recover your database in case it becomes unavailable due to a disruptive event.

trans-unit.source: You can contact support to restore a database from a geo-redundant backup to create a new database in any Azure region.
trans-unit.target: You can contact support to restore a database from a geo-redundant backup to create a new database in any Azure region.

trans-unit.source: Because the backup is geo-redundant it can be used to recover a database even if the database is inaccessible due to an outage.
trans-unit.target: Because the backup is geo-redundant it can be used to recover a database even if the database is inaccessible due to an outage.

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore feature comes with no additional charges.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore feature comes with no additional charges.

trans-unit.source: To learn about the business continuity features of other SQL Database editions, please read the <linkText>SQL Database business continuity overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn about the business continuity features of other SQL Database editions, please read the <linkText>SQL Database business continuity overview</linkText><title></title>.
